original: 'di gnyis ni phyag tu gtogs /
analyzed: 'di gnyis ni phyag tu gtogs /

original: khyim pa sprid pa byung ba dang dge slong rgan po nad pa la sos zhes byas kyang nyes med /
analyzed: khyim pa sprid pa byung ba dang dge slong rgan po nad pa la sos zhes byas kyang nyes med /

analyzed: gzhon nu sprid pa byung na rgan po la phyag bya /

analyzed: de ltar ma byas na nyes byas / snga ma las ma yin /

translated: Do not address a buddha who has passed into parinirvƒÅ·πáa as ‚Äúvenerable‚Äù or ‚Äúblessed one.‚Äù

analyzed: 'ong pa dang 'gro ba 'grub pa'i dngos po las sar pa pa gtsug lag khang du gzhag / dge slong gis dge 'dun gyi phyir gtsug lag khang brtsig na dgon pa dang dben par mi brtsig gi mi mang po 'du zhing phyag 'tshal ba'i gnas su brtsig /
translated: If a monk builds a temple for the sake of the Sa·πÖgha, he should not build it in a remote place, but in a place where many people gather and pay homage.

analyzed: tshal dang rtsing bu dang bcag pa yang ngo //
translated: It should have a garden, a flower garden, and a walking path.

original: ltag ma ltar gtsug lag khang brtsig pa ni tshal chu bzang po dang / me tog bzang po dang 'chag pa spang bar bya /
analyzed: ltag ma ltar gtsug lag khang brtsig pa ni tshal chu bzang po dang / me tog bzang po dang 'chag pa spang bar bya /
translated: When building a temple, one should avoid a garden with excellent water, excellent flowers, and a walking path.

original: nye mtshams kyang ngo //
analyzed: nye mtshams kyang ngo //
translated: It should also have an outer boundary.

original: gtsug lag khang gcong rong dang gad khar mi brtsig par bde bar brtsig / lang long dang sgra dang skad dang dbyangs nyung bar ro //
analyzed: gtsug lag khang gcong rong dang gad khar mi brtsig par bde bar brtsig / lang long dang sgra dang skad dang dbyangs nyung bar ro //
translated: A temple should be built comfortably, not in a ravine or on a cliff, with little noise, sound, and commotion.

original: mi mang po 'du ba'i sar gtsug lag khang brtsig pa dang / spangs shing dben pa glu gar dang ca co nyung ba'i sar brtsig / sbyin bdag gis gnang na gtsug lag khang bya ba'i phyir gyi dngos pos de bya ba'i de'i snod du bya /
analyzed: mi mang po 'du ba'i sar gtsug lag khang brtsig pa dang / spangs shing dben pa glu gar dang ca co nyung ba'i sar brtsig / sbyin bdag gis gnang na gtsug lag khang bya ba'i phyir gyi dngos pos de bya ba'i de'i snod du bya /
translated: If the patron allows it, use the things intended for the temple for the purpose of the temple.

original: gtsug lag khang brtsig pa'i sta zor dang gzhor spyad nyon nyes sam ma nyes zhes dris te ma nyes zhes zer na'o //
analyzed: gtsug lag khang brtsig pa'i sta zor dang gzhor spyad nyon nyes sam ma nyes zhes dris te ma nyes zhes zer na'o //
translated: Ask, ‚ÄúIs there any loss or damage to the materials and tools for building the temple?‚Äù If they say, ‚ÄúThere is no loss,‚Äù

original: de gzhag pa'i phyir khung bu sbyin /
analyzed: de gzhag pa'i phyir khung bu sbyin /
translated: give them a hole to put it in.

original: ltag ma'i gzhor spyad mi 'khyams pa'i phyir khang bu gnyis brtsigs te spyad der brub /
analyzed: ltag ma'i gzhor spyad mi 'khyams pa'i phyir khang bu gnyis brtsigs te spyad der brub /
translated: In order to prevent the loss of the materials for the roof, build two houses and use them.

original: der mkho ba yungs mar la sogs pa ran par nyo //
analyzed: der mkho ba yungs mar la sogs pa ran par nyo //
translated: Buy the necessary things, such as mustard oil, in the right amount.üîΩBuy the oil for rubbing the feet, hands, and the eyes of the carts of the workers, and keep it.

original: las mi rnams kyi rkang lag bsku ba dang 'breng ba dang shing rta'i mig bsku ba'i mar nyos te gzhag / ci ltar tho ngan pa de ltar las sar pa'i zas so //
analyzed: las mi rnams kyi rkang lag bsku ba dang 'breng ba dang shing rta'i mig bsku ba'i mar nyos te gzhag / ci ltar tho ngan pa de ltar las sar pa'i zas so //
translated: Eat the food of the workers as badly as possible.

original: gtsug lag khang brtsig pa'i zhal ta ba'i dge slong dge 'dun dang zan thang mnyam par tho ngan gyis bsnyams shing sbyin /
analyzed: gtsug lag khang brtsig pa'i zhal ta ba'i dge slong dge 'dun dang zan thang mnyam par tho ngan gyis bsnyams shing sbyin /
translated: The monk who is the supervisor of the construction of a temple should be paid the same as the community, and he should be paid by means of a vote.

original: gtsug lag khang med na de'i gnas 'khor gyi gtsug lag khang du'o //
analyzed: gtsug lag khang med na de'i gnas 'khor gyi gtsug lag khang du'o //
translated: If there is no temple, it is in the temple of the surrounding area.

original: gtsug lag khang brtsig pa'i dge slong las kyis brel te dge 'dun nang du ma 'ongs na dge 'dun gyis zan thang bzhin du ga la 'dug par bskyal te sbyin /
analyzed: gtsug lag khang brtsig pa'i dge slong las kyis brel te dge 'dun nang du ma 'ongs na dge 'dun gyis zan thang bzhin du ga la 'dug par bskyal te sbyin /
translated: If the monk who is building the temple is busy with work and does not come to the community, the community should send someone to give him his share of the food.

original: thob na blangs /
analyzed: thob na blangs /
translated: If he gets it, he should accept it.

original: las pa'i dge slong las che ba'i phyir dge 'dun dang yon bdag gis pha la zan blangs te byin kyang brtags pa'o //
analyzed: las pa'i dge slong las che ba'i phyir dge 'dun dang yon bdag gis pha la zan blangs te byin kyang brtags pa'o //
translated: Because the monk who is working is superior, the community and the donors should take the food for the father and give it to him. This is the examination.

original: gtsug lag khang gi mtha' ni rim lnga'o //üîΩdge slong gis gtsug lag khang rtsig na snyi @329a * //
analyzed: gtsug lag khang gi mtha' ni rim lnga'o // dge slong gis gtsug lag khang rtsig na snyi @329a * //
translated: The limit of the temple is five steps.

original: ba'i phyir rim pa lnga rtsig las mi brtsig go //
analyzed: ba'i phyir rim pa lnga rtsig las mi brtsig go //
translated: If a monk builds a temple, he should build it five steps high for the sake of the earth goddess. He should not build it higher than that.

original: dge slong ma'i ni rim gsum mo //
analyzed: dge slong ma'i ni rim gsum mo //
translated: For nuns, it is three steps.

original: dge slong ma'i gtsug lag khang rim gsum las mi brtsig / dri gtsang khang dang sgo phubs mi gnyis kyis lhag par ro //
analyzed: dge slong ma'i gtsug lag khang rim gsum las mi brtsig / dri gtsang khang dang sgo phubs mi gnyis kyis lhag par ro //
translated: A nunnery is not to be built more than three stories high; and the temple and the gate-tower are not to be built more than two stories high.

original: dri gtsang khang dang sgo phubs ni bsil ba'i phyir bdun brtsegs su 'ang brtsig tu rung ngo //
analyzed: dri gtsang khang dang sgo phubs ni bsil ba'i phyir bdun brtsegs su 'ang brtsig tu rung ngo //
translated: The temple and the gate-tower may be built seven stories high if they are for cooling purposes.

original: lci sto mi thub na gzhag pa ni nyes med do //
analyzed: lci sto mi thub na gzhag pa ni nyes med do //
translated: If one is unable to build a heavy one, it is not a fault to build a light one.

original: gtsug lag khang rim zhig brtsigs te ka ba dag gis mi thub na brtsag ma dang po gzhig kyang nyes med do //
analyzed: gtsug lag khang rim zhig brtsigs te ka ba dag gis mi thub na brtsag ma dang po gzhig kyang nyes med do //
translated: If one builds a temple with a single story and is unable to support it with pillars, it is not a fault to build a second story.

original: brtsams la che bar ram chung bar bcags pa yang ngo //
analyzed: brtsams la che bar ram chung bar bcags pa yang ngo //
translated: It is also not a fault to build a temple that is either larger or smaller than the original plan.

original: yon bdag gis gtsug lag khang zhig dang po chung ngur brtsigs pa las phyis dad pa skyes te de bshigs te cher byas kyang rung ngo //
analyzed: yon bdag gis gtsug lag khang zhig dang po chung ngur brtsigs pa las phyis dad pa skyes te de bshigs te cher byas kyang rung ngo //
translated: If a temple is first built small by a patron, but later, when faith arises, it is torn down and built larger, that is also acceptable.

original: chen po zhig brtsams pa las rgyu zad de phyis bskyungs te brtsigs kyang nyes med do //
analyzed: chen po zhig brtsams pa las rgyu zad de phyis bskyungs te brtsigs kyang nyes med do //
translated: If a large temple is begun but the materials are exhausted, it is not a fault to leave it and build it later.

original: che ba'i phyir na mchod rten dang gzugs kyang ngo //
analyzed: che ba'i phyir na mchod rten dang gzugs kyang ngo //
translated: Because of its size, a stupa or an image is also acceptable.

original: lce te'am sku ba'i gzugs thog ma chung dur brtsig par brtsams pa las de las cher bskyed pa'i phyir bshigs te cher brtsigs kyang nyes med do //
analyzed: lce te'am sku ba'i gzugs thog ma chung dur brtsig par brtsams pa las de las cher bskyed pa'i phyir bshigs te cher brtsigs kyang nyes med do //
translated: If one builds a stupa or an image of the Buddha, and then destroys it in order to make it bigger, there is no fault.

original: zhig ste 'drang ba'i phyir na zin kyang ngo //
analyzed: zhig ste 'drang ba'i phyir na zin kyang ngo //
translated: If one destroys it in order to make it straight, there is no fault.

original: mchod rten rnying pa zhig de tsam gyi tshod nam de bas che bar bya ba'i phyir bshigs te byas kyang nyes med /
analyzed: mchod rten rnying pa zhig de tsam gyi tshod nam de bas che bar bya ba'i phyir bshigs te byas kyang nyes med /
translated: If one destroys an old stupa in order to make it bigger, there is no fault.

original: phyogs bcos pa'i phyir kyang ngo //
analyzed: phyogs bcos pa'i phyir kyang ngo //
translated: If one destroys it in order to repair it, there is no fault.

original: mchod rten nam gzugs phyogs gcig ral lam zhig pa de nyi tshe bshigs la slar bcos kyang nyes med /
analyzed: mchod rten nam gzugs phyogs gcig ral lam zhig pa de nyi tshe bshigs la slar bcos kyang nyes med /
translated: If one destroys a part of a stupa or an image in order to repair it, there is no fault.

original: gdugs la sogs pa dbab pa yang ngo //üîΩlce ti'i 'phang lo rnying pa slar phab la sar pa btsugs kyang nyes med do //üîΩbshigs pa'i sdig kyang nyes med /
analyzed: gdugs la sogs pa dbab pa yang ngo // lce ti'i 'phang lo rnying pa slar phab la sar pa btsugs kyang nyes med do // bshigs pa'i sdig kyang nyes med /
translated: If one removes a parasol, etc.,üîΩif one removes an old wheel of a stupa and puts up a new one, there is no fault.

original: gzhan gzugs pa'i phyir na yang ngo //
analyzed: gzhan gzugs pa'i phyir na yang ngo //
translated: There is no fault in destroying a stupa in order to make another.

original: lce ti'i gdugs dang srog shing dang 'phang lo ma legs pa slar phab la legs pa btsugs kyang nyes med do //
analyzed: lce ti'i gdugs dang srog shing dang 'phang lo ma legs pa slar phab la legs pa btsugs kyang nyes med do //
translated: If the parasol, life-tree, or axle of a caitya are not well-made, they should be removed and well-made ones erected in their place, but there is no fault if this is not done.

original: de'i phyir ba nye bar ma bzhag par mi dbab /
analyzed: de'i phyir ba nye bar ma bzhag par mi dbab /
translated: Therefore, do not take down a caitya without having something to replace it.

original: ltag ma ltar mchod rten nam gzugs bshigs pa ni yo byad thams cad sogs la gzhig gis ma sogs par bshigs te phyed ral du mi bsdu bar mi dor /üîΩskyis pa'i rabs la sogs pa bris pa dang sangs rgyas kyi tshig bris pa yang ngo //
analyzed: ltag ma ltar mchod rten nam gzugs bshigs pa ni yo byad thams cad sogs la gzhig gis ma sogs par bshigs te phyed ral du mi bsdu bar mi dor / skyis pa'i rabs la sogs pa bris pa dang sangs rgyas kyi tshig bris pa yang ngo //
translated: If you destroy a caitya or image, do not destroy it by gathering up all the materials and then discarding them.üîΩDo not destroy images of the Buddha or of the lineage of spiritual masters.

original: mdzangs blun gyi rgyud bris pa dang zhal nas gsungs pa'i tshig rtsig pa'i ngos la bris pa dang slar de bzhin du brtsig cing bcos /
analyzed: mdzangs blun gyi rgyud bris pa dang zhal nas gsungs pa'i tshig rtsig pa'i ngos la bris pa dang slar de bzhin du brtsig cing bcos /
translated: Do not destroy images of the wise and the foolish, or the words of the Buddha written on the walls of a building.

original: ri gang bcag pa 'bogs par bya ba'i phyir kyang ngo //
analyzed: ri gang bcag pa 'bogs par bya ba'i phyir kyang ngo //
translated: If you are repairing a building, do not destroy the images and so forth.

original: ri mo dang skyong nul gos pa zhig yod na gang du bgos @329b pa der ri mo dang skyong nul bzang du bya /
analyzed: ri mo dang skyong nul gos pa zhig yod na gang du bgos @329b pa der ri mo dang skyong nul bzang du bya /
translated: If the murals and plaster are damaged, repair the murals and plaster in the place where they were.

original: bya ba brtsams te ma byas pa lhag ma gzhan gyis so //
analyzed: bya ba brtsams te ma byas pa lhag ma gzhan gyis so //
translated: If one begins a task and does not complete it, another may finish it.

original: dge slong ma yon bdag gis gtsug lag khang phyed tsam brtsigs nas ma zin par bor ba la dge slong gis zin par brtsigs kyang nyes med /
analyzed: dge slong ma yon bdag gis gtsug lag khang phyed tsam brtsigs nas ma zin par bor ba la dge slong gis zin par brtsigs kyang nyes med /
translated: If a patroness of the nuns builds only half a temple and abandons it, a monk may complete it without fault.

original: de ste dge 'dun gyi phyir na phyed langs pa las bslab pa sbyin /
analyzed: de ste dge 'dun gyi phyir na phyed langs pa las bslab pa sbyin /
translated: If it is for the sake of the community, the training should be given when half is completed.

original: dge 'dun gyi phyir yon bdag gis gtsug lag khang phyed tsam zhig brtsigs pa las dge slong gis grogs byas te zin par brtsigs kyang nyes med do //
analyzed: dge 'dun gyi phyir yon bdag gis gtsug lag khang phyed tsam zhig brtsigs pa las dge slong gis grogs byas te zin par brtsigs kyang nyes med do //
translated: If a patron builds only half a temple for the sake of the community, a monk may help complete it without fault.

original: de sbyin pa'i dus ni de ste dgun na phyi dro'o //
analyzed: de sbyin pa'i dus ni de ste dgun na phyi dro'o //
translated: The time for giving is this: in winter, in the afternoon.

original: ltag ma ltar yon bdag gis gtsug lag khang brtsigs pa dge slong gis btang ba ni dgun grang na phyi dro gtang /üîΩdpyid tsha na snga dro'o //
analyzed: ltag ma ltar yon bdag gis gtsug lag khang brtsigs pa dge slong gis btang ba ni dgun grang na phyi dro gtang / dpyid tsha na snga dro'o //
translated: If a patron builds a temple and a monk gives it away, in winter when it is cold, it should be given away in the afternoon.üîΩIn spring when it is hot, it should be given away in the morning.

original: dpyid tsha na snga dro gtang ngo //
analyzed: dpyid tsha na snga dro gtang ngo //
translated: In spring when it is hot, it should be given away in the morning.

original: zas kyi bya ba'i dus ma lus par ro //
analyzed: zas kyi bya ba'i dus ma lus par ro //
translated: It should be given away at the time of the meal without exception.

original: gtsug lag khang slong ba'i dge slong bsod snyoms pa yin pa zhig dus las sngar bsod snyoms la 'gro //
analyzed: gtsug lag khang slong ba'i dge slong bsod snyoms pa yin pa zhig dus las sngar bsod snyoms la 'gro //
translated: A monk who begs for a temple is a monk who begs for alms. He should go for alms before the proper time.

original: gtsug lag khang zhig na dus pas sngar bza'/
analyzed: gtsug lag khang zhig na dus pas sngar bza'/
translated: He should eat before the proper time in a temple.üîΩHe should not enter for alms without being prepared.

original: sta gon ma byas par bsod snyoms la mi 'jug / gtsug lag khang brtsigs pa'i dge slong bsod snyoms la 'jug pa'i tshe /
analyzed: sta gon ma byas par bsod snyoms la mi 'jug / gtsug lag khang brtsigs pa'i dge slong bsod snyoms la 'jug pa'i tshe /
translated: When a monk who is building a temple enters for alms,

original: rdul dang 'ji ba med par byas te 'gro //
analyzed: rdul dang 'ji ba med par byas te 'gro //
translated: he should go without dust and mud.

original: rkang pa dang lag pa bkrus pa ni de'i mtha'o //
analyzed: rkang pa dang lag pa bkrus pa ni de'i mtha'o //
translated: Washing the feet and hands is the end of that.

original: ltag ma ltar bkru ba lus kun bkru ma nus na rkang lag bzhi bkru /
analyzed: ltag ma ltar bkru ba lus kun bkru ma nus na rkang lag bzhi bkru /
translated: If one is unable to wash the whole body like a sheep, one should wash the four limbs.

original: nang bar zas sar pas bskul /
analyzed: nang bar zas sar pas bskul /
translated: In the morning, one should be urged to eat by the sound of a gong.

original: gtsug lag khang brtsigs pa'i dge slong gis yon bdag la dge slong gsar bus las byed pa rnams bkres kyis nang par g-yar sus sbyin no zhes bsgo //
analyzed: gtsug lag khang brtsigs pa'i dge slong gis yon bdag la dge slong gsar bus las byed pa rnams bkres kyis nang par g-yar sus sbyin no zhes bsgo //
translated: A monk who is building a temple should tell the patron, ‚ÄúTomorrow morning, the young monks who are doing the work will be hungry. Who will provide food?‚Äù

original: phyi dro rkang lag gi bsku ba dang skom kyang ngo //
analyzed: phyi dro rkang lag gi bsku ba dang skom kyang ngo //
translated: In the evening, there should be oil for anointing the feet and hands and also drinks.

original: yon bdag la las byed pa'i dge slong rnams la rkang lag lam ral sogs pas bsku ba'i rigs so zhes bya /
analyzed: yon bdag la las byed pa'i dge slong rnams la rkang lag lam ral sogs pas bsku ba'i rigs so zhes bya /

original: khang bu dag gi sgo bya /
analyzed: khang bu dag gi sgo bya /
translated: The door of the cells should be made.

original: gtsug lag khang brtsigs na khang bur sgo bya /
analyzed: gtsug lag khang brtsigs na khang bur sgo bya /

original: sgo leb sbyin /
analyzed: sgo leb sbyin /

analyzed: sgo la sgo leb sbyin lag gzungs mang mig dang pags pa'i dum bu'o //
translated: The door-panel should be given to the door. The door-bolt has many eyes and a piece of leather.

original: sgo leb la nang nas drang pa dang phyir gcad pa'i lag gzungs dang yang mig dang sgo dbye ba krig krig mi ze bar ko bas dkri /üîΩskar khung gdod /

original: khang bu la skar khung gdod de /
analyzed: khang bu la skar khung gdod de /
translated: The window should be made in the cell.

original: dbus su'o // skar khung rtsig pa'i dbus su gdod //
analyzed: dbus su'o // skar khung rtsig pa'i dbus su gdod //

analyzed: phyi rub cing nang yangs pa rgya mtsho mching rnams lta bur ro //
translated: Outside it is narrow and inside it is wide, like the ocean and a pond.

original: de'i ka ba phreng du'o //
analyzed: de'i ka ba phreng du'o //
translated: The pillars are in a row.

original: ltag ma'i ka pa'i phreng du gzugs /
analyzed: ltag ma'i ka pa'i phreng du gzugs /
translated: The row of pillars of the roof is constructed.

original: de dag la ka zhu'o //
analyzed: de dag la ka zhu'o //
translated: They are called pillars.

original: ka ba de rnams la ka zhu sbyin /
analyzed: ka ba de rnams la ka zhu sbyin /
translated: The pillars are given a capital.

original: de dag la gdung bre /
analyzed: de dag la gdung bre /
translated: They are called beams.

original: ka ba dang ka zhu btsugs pa la gdung bre /
analyzed: ka ba dang ka zhu btsugs pa la gdung bre /
translated: The beams are placed on the pillars and capitals.

original: de dag la phyam mo //üîΩde'i 'og tu phyam bre /
analyzed: de dag la phyam mo // de'i 'og tu phyam bre /
translated: They are called crossbeams.üîΩThe crossbeams are placed below them.

original: de dag la spang leb po //
analyzed: de dag la spang leb po //
translated: They are called planks.

original: phyam gyi steng spang leb gzhib /
analyzed: phyam gyi steng spang leb gzhib /
translated: The planks are placed on top of the crossbeams.

original: de ltar pha gu gding /
analyzed: de ltar pha gu gding /
translated: In that way, the coping is placed.

original: spang leb kyi steng du pha gu gding /
analyzed: spang leb kyi steng du pha gu gding /
translated: The coping is placed on top of the planks.

original: de dag la so phag gi phye ma'o //
analyzed: de dag la so phag gi phye ma'o //
translated: They are made of brick dust.

original: pha gu'i steng du so phag bkrum pa bdal /
analyzed: pha gu'i steng du so phag bkrum pa bdal /
translated: The bricks are spread on top of the coping.

original: mi ltung ba'i phyir be ti ka bya /
analyzed: mi ltung ba'i phyir be ti ka bya /
translated: In order to prevent them from falling, a parapet is made.

original: mi ltung bar bya ba'i phyir sgo dang khyams kyi mdun du mda' yab bya /
analyzed: mi ltung bar bya ba'i phyir sgo dang khyams kyi mdun du mda' yab bya /
translated: In order to prevent them from falling, a rainspout is made in front of the door and the courtyard.

original: de mi g-yo ba'i phyir de la 'brel ba bya /
analyzed: de mi g-yo ba'i phyir de la 'brel ba bya /
translated: In order to prevent them from moving, they are connected.

original: ltag ma'i mda' yab mi g-yo bar shing gse sbrel /üîΩlcags kyi gzer bus de dag la sbrel /
analyzed: ltag ma'i mda' yab mi g-yo bar shing gse sbrel / lcags kyi gzer bus de dag la sbrel /
translated: The rainspout of the roof is connected with a tree.üîΩThey are connected with iron nails.

original: de'i mdor mi 'khrul par lcags gzer gyis gdab /
analyzed: de'i mdor mi 'khrul par lcags gzer gyis gdab /
translated: In order to prevent them from moving, iron nails are driven in at the corners.

original: 'dzeg pa'i phyir thang ma skas bya /
analyzed: 'dzeg pa'i phyir thang ma skas bya /
translated: In order to climb up, make a ladder of bamboo.

original: rim kang steng ma la 'dzeg pa'i phyir thang ma skas bya 'og ma ni rdo las 'og ma'i skas ni rdo las bya /
analyzed: rim kang steng ma la 'dzeg pa'i phyir thang ma skas bya 'og ma ni rdo las 'og ma'i skas ni rdo las bya /
translated: In order to climb up the upper story, make a ladder of bamboo. The lower one is made of stone. The lower ladder is made of stone.

original: bar ma ni kham pa las /
analyzed: bar ma ni kham pa las /
translated: The middle one is made of bricks.

original: bar ma'i skas ni kham pa las bya /
analyzed: bar ma'i skas ni kham pa las bya /
translated: The middle ladder is made of bricks.

original: steng ma shing las rigs gsum gyi dang po'i skas ni shing las bya /
analyzed: steng ma shing las rigs gsum gyi dang po'i skas ni shing las bya /
translated: The upper one is made of wood. The ladder of the first type is made of wood.

original: skas la 'dzeg / ltag ma lta bu'i skas med na shing la zag bas bres pa'i skas la 'dzeg / shing dang smyig ma dang thag pa'i yang ngo //
analyzed: skas la 'dzeg / ltag ma lta bu'i skas med na shing la zag bas bres pa'i skas la 'dzeg / shing dang smyig ma dang thag pa'i yang ngo //
translated: If there is no ladder like the back of a camel, climb a ladder made of wood with ropes tied to it. It is also made of wood, bamboo, and rope.

original: lhag ma'i skas kyi rgyu ni ming gis smos pa 'di rnams la bya /üîΩrdzab tu mi 'gyur ba'i phyir mthangs kyi gzhi dang sgo khang du pha gu gding /
analyzed: lhag ma'i skas kyi rgyu ni ming gis smos pa 'di rnams la bya / rdzab tu mi 'gyur ba'i phyir mthangs kyi gzhi dang sgo khang du pha gu gding /
translated: The material of the remaining ladders is to be understood by the names.üîΩIn order to prevent the mud from flowing, the base of the steps and the porch are covered with tin.

original: sgo khang dang khyams la sogs ba rdzab tu mi 'gyur ba'i phyir gzhi so phag gis gding /
analyzed: sgo khang dang khyams la sogs ba rdzab tu mi 'gyur ba'i phyir gzhi so phag gis gding /
translated: In order to prevent the porch, courtyard, and so forth from becoming muddy, the base is covered with bricks.

original: de'i steng du @330b so phag gi phye mas gding /
analyzed: de'i steng du @330b so phag gi phye mas gding /
translated: On top of that, the base is covered with brick dust.

original: ltag ma'i so phag gi srubs su so phag bkrum pa'i phyes bdal /
analyzed: ltag ma'i so phag gi srubs su so phag bkrum pa'i phyes bdal /
translated: In the cracks of the lower bricks, fill the cracks with mortar.

original: de la mdo yang ngo //
analyzed: de la mdo yang ngo //
translated: On top of that, put the sutras.

original: steng ma'i so phag gi steng du rdo thal gyis skyong nul thogs /
analyzed: steng ma'i so phag gi steng du rdo thal gyis skyong nul thogs /
translated: On top of the upper bricks, put a layer of lime plaster.

original: med na rkang pa'i skyabs kyi phyir shing leb kyang ngo //
analyzed: med na rkang pa'i skyabs kyi phyir shing leb kyang ngo //
translated: If there is no lime plaster, for the sake of protecting the feet, put wooden planks.

original: ltag ma ltar 'dam rdzab kyi sar so phag gis ma bting na ga las gar 'gro ba'i sar shing leb gding /
analyzed: ltag ma ltar 'dam rdzab kyi sar so phag gis ma bting na ga las gar 'gro ba'i sar shing leb gding /
translated: If the ground is muddy, like the lower part, spread wooden planks on the ground wherever you go.

original: bar bar du pha gu yang ngo //
analyzed: bar bar du pha gu yang ngo //
translated: In between, put railings.üîΩIf you cannot spread wooden planks, put bricks one by one.

original: shing leb gding du med na so phag gis gom pa re rer gzhag / mchod rten kyang de bzhin no //
analyzed: shing leb gding du med na so phag gis gom pa re rer gzhag / mchod rten kyang de bzhin no //
translated: Do the same for stupas.

original: mchod rten bskor ba na 'dam rdzab yod na ltag ma'i rim pa ltar gang 'byor pa gding ngo //
analyzed: mchod rten bskor ba na 'dam rdzab yod na ltag ma'i rim pa ltar gang 'byor pa gding ngo //
translated: If there is mud when circumambulating a stupa, spread whatever you can afford, like the lower part.

original: der 'dom tsam byas na byas pa'o //
analyzed: der 'dom tsam byas na byas pa'o //
translated: If you do this for the length of a cubit, it is considered done.üîΩPlace wood and bricks in front of the stupa, but keep them a cubit away.

original: mchod rten gyi drung du shing dang so phag gzhag pa 'dom gang tsam nas mi nye bar gzhag / seng ge'i stan gru bzhi po bya /
analyzed: mchod rten gyi drung du shing dang so phag gzhag pa 'dom gang tsam nas mi nye bar gzhag / seng ge'i stan gru bzhi po bya /
translated: Make a square lion throne.

original: bcu bzhi dang bco lnga'i tshe chos 'chad pa'i khri 'og tu seng ge 'dug tu rung bar steng gru bzhi por bya /
analyzed: bcu bzhi dang bco lnga'i tshe chos 'chad pa'i khri 'og tu seng ge 'dug tu rung bar steng gru bzhi por bya /
translated: At the time of the fourteenth and fifteenth days, the four corners of the lion throne should be made so that a lion can sit underneath the Dharma seat.

original: rkang pa seng ge gdong du bya /
analyzed: rkang pa seng ge gdong du bya /
translated: The legs should be made in the form of lions.

original: ltag ma'i khri 'dug pa'i gzhi rkang pa seng ge bzhi'i gzugs bya'o //üîΩspro ba'i tshe gzung ba'i phyir gzhi char bu yang lcags kyi yang mig gdags /
analyzed: ltag ma'i khri 'dug pa'i gzhi rkang pa seng ge bzhi'i gzugs bya'o // spro ba'i tshe gzung ba'i phyir gzhi char bu yang lcags kyi yang mig gdags /
translated: The legs of the seat of the lion throne should be made in the form of four lions.

original: seng ge'i khri yan man spo ba'i phyir grva bzhir lcags kyi yang mig btags te bskur du rung bar bya /
analyzed: seng ge'i khri yan man spo ba'i phyir grva bzhir lcags kyi yang mig btags te bskur du rung bar bya /
translated: In order to carry it when it is to be taken to another place, the base should be covered with iron and made so that it can be carried.

original: gshur bu gdags /
analyzed: gshur bu gdags /
translated: The base should be covered with iron.

original: khri'i steng gi gzhi snam bu sor bzhi tsam gyis dra bar bre /
analyzed: khri'i steng gi gzhi snam bu sor bzhi tsam gyis dra bar bre /
translated: The base of the lion throne should be woven with a cloth of four fingerbreadths.

original: bar tshangs can gding /üîΩde'i steng du shing bal can gyi stan gding /
analyzed: bar tshangs can gding / de'i steng du shing bal can gyi stan gding /
translated: It should be spread with a cloth with a fringe.üîΩOn top of that, a cushion with cotton should be spread.

original: steng du gnam yol /
analyzed: steng du gnam yol /
translated: On top of that, a canopy should be spread.

original: khri steng na chos 'chad pa la steng du gnam yol bya /
analyzed: khri steng na chos 'chad pa la steng du gnam yol bya /
translated: When teaching Dharma on the lion throne, a canopy should be spread above.

original: sbyar ba yang ngo //
analyzed: sbyar ba yang ngo //
translated: It should also be attached.

original: grva bzhir 'phan gdags /
analyzed: grva bzhir 'phan gdags /
translated: Flags should be placed in the four corners.

original: thang ma skas byas te mi bskyod na thag bu las so //
analyzed: thang ma skas byas te mi bskyod na thag bu las so //
translated: If it cannot be carried without shaking, it should be carried by ropes.

original: seng ge'i khri mi bskyod par gnas gcig na gzhan so phag las thang ma skas bya /
analyzed: seng ge'i khri mi bskyod par gnas gcig na gzhan so phag las thang ma skas bya /
translated: The lion throne is placed on an unshakable base.

original: spos shing las so //
analyzed: spos shing las so //
translated: The base is made of bricks.

original: yan man spong dgos na shing skam 'dom gang tsam pa bya /
analyzed: yan man spong dgos na shing skam 'dom gang tsam pa bya /
translated: If it is necessary to avoid going up and down, the base should be a dry tree about one cubit high.

original: mi 'grub skas kyang ngo //
analyzed: mi 'grub skas kyang ngo //
translated: If it is not possible, there should be a staircase.

original: skas thang ma skas ma 'byor na shing la bres pa'i skas bya /
analyzed: skas thang ma skas ma 'byor na shing la bres pa'i skas bya /
translated: If it is not possible to make a staircase, a ladder should be made of wood.

original: rkang pa'i khre'u yang ngo //
analyzed: rkang pa'i khre'u yang ngo //
translated: There should also be a footrest.

original: seng ge'i khri la 'dug pa'i tshe rkang pa gzhag pa'i khri'u gcig gzhag / mchod /
analyzed: seng ge'i khri la 'dug pa'i tshe rkang pa gzhag pa'i khri'u gcig gzhag / mchod /
translated: When sitting on the lion throne, one should place a footstool.

original: seng ge'i khri la 'dug pa'i mdun du me tog dang / pog spos dgram /
analyzed: seng ge'i khri la 'dug pa'i mdun du me tog dang / pog spos dgram /
translated: In front of the lion throne, flowers and incense should be arranged.

original: lo ma'i phung po steng du gding /
analyzed: lo ma'i phung po steng du gding /
translated: A pile of leaves should be spread out.

original: ltag ma ltar me tog la sogs pa mchod pa med na shing lo sngon po dgram /
analyzed: ltag ma ltar me tog la sogs pa mchod pa med na shing lo sngon po dgram /
translated: If there are no offerings such as flowers, a blue leaf should be arranged.

original: rtsva thum kyang ngo //
analyzed: rtsva thum kyang ngo //
translated: There should also be a bundle of grass.

original: rkang pa gzhag pa'i khri'u med na khri'u skyin pa rtsva thum gzhag / rkang pa 'phyang pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rkang pa gzhag pa'i khri'u med na khri'u skyin pa rtsva thum gzhag / rkang pa 'phyang pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If there is no footstool, a substitute footstool should be placed, a bundle of grass, because the feet would hang down.

original: @331a * // ltag ma ltar rtsva thum ma bzhag na rkang pa 'phyang ste nang du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: @331a * // ltag ma ltar rtsva thum ma bzhag na rkang pa 'phyang ste nang du 'gyur ro //
translated: If one does not place a bundle of grass on the roof, the feet will hang down inside.

original: der rdos kyang 'grub po /
analyzed: der rdos kyang 'grub po /
translated: It is also accomplished with a stone.

original: rtsva thum med na so phag gam rdos kyang ngo //
analyzed: rtsva thum med na so phag gam rdos kyang ngo //
translated: If there is no bundle of grass, it is also with a brick or a stone.

original: bya rog dang bye'u dang phug ron dag zan za ba la mi 'tshe ba'i phyir dra ba sbyin /
analyzed: bya rog dang bye'u dang phug ron dag zan za ba la mi 'tshe ba'i phyir dra ba sbyin /
translated: In order not to harm the crows, birds and pigeons that eat the food, one should give a net.

original: khyams na dge 'dun bshos gsol ba la ming gis smos pa'i bya rnams mi 'ong bar bya ba'i phyir dra bas bre /
analyzed: khyams na dge 'dun bshos gsol ba la ming gis smos pa'i bya rnams mi 'ong bar bya ba'i phyir dra bas bre /
translated: In order to prevent the birds mentioned by name from coming to the Sa·πÖgha who is eating in the courtyard, one should cover with a net.

original: de rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: de rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: That is of four types.

original: dra ba'i gzhi rnam bzhi ste 'og nas 'chad /
analyzed: dra ba'i gzhi rnam bzhi ste 'og nas 'chad /

original: mo la dzo dang bal ba za dang sha na shing bal gyis zhes so //
analyzed: mo la dzo dang bal ba za dang sha na shing bal gyis zhes so //
translated: Molajo, balabaja, and sanasina with cotton.

original: ming gis smos pa 'di rnams las dra ba'i rgyu bya /
analyzed: ming gis smos pa 'di rnams las dra ba'i rgyu bya /
translated: From these mentioned by name, one should make the net.

original: gru bzhir yang mig gdags /
analyzed: gru bzhir yang mig gdags /

original: khyams kyi grva dra ba gdags pa'i yang mig bya /
analyzed: khyams kyi grva dra ba gdags pa'i yang mig bya /
translated: In the corners of the courtyard, one should make eyes for attaching the net.

original: de la bcing /
analyzed: de la bcing /
translated: One should tie it there.

original: dra ba yang mig la gdags /
analyzed: dra ba yang mig la gdags /
translated: The net is also put on the eyes.

original: shing gi ni rgas shing 'drul bas de'i phyir lcags kyi'o //
analyzed: shing gi ni rgas shing 'drul bas de'i phyir lcags kyi'o //
translated: Since the wooden one becomes old and worn out, therefore it is made of iron.

original: dra ba gdags pa'i mig shing las byas na snyi ba'i phyir lcags las bya /
analyzed: dra ba gdags pa'i mig shing las byas na snyi ba'i phyir lcags las bya /
translated: Therefore, it should be made of iron.

original: de'i phyogs gcig tu bu gu bya /
analyzed: de'i phyogs gcig tu bu gu bya /
translated: A hole should be made in one side of it.

original: dra ba'i phyogs gcig tu sgo gdod /
analyzed: dra ba'i phyogs gcig tu sgo gdod /
translated: One side of the net should be left open.

original: zos nas 'jug pa'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: zos nas 'jug pa'i phyir ro ;
translated: After eating, the birds enter.

original: / dge 'dun bshos gsol nas zan brul la pug ron la sogs pa thur gzhug pa'i phyir sgo dbye /
analyzed: / dge 'dun bshos gsol nas zan brul la pug ron la sogs pa thur gzhug pa'i phyir sgo dbye /
translated: After the Sa·πÖgha has eaten, the door should be opened to allow the pigeons and so on to enter with the leftovers.

analyzed: gdug tshod kyi tshe de dgag / bshos gsol ba'i tshe bya mi 'ong ba'i phyir dra ba'i sgo gcad / khyams su char pa mi 'bab par leb kheng pos dgab ka ba'i bar du bya'o //
translated: At the time of the meal, it should be closed to prevent the birds from entering.üîΩIn the courtyard, a rain gutter should be made to cover the space between the pillars so that rain does not fall.

analyzed: khyams su dge 'dun bshos gsol ba'i tshe rdzi char mi 'ong bar bya ba'i phyir phyam dang ka ba'i bar nas spang leb kyis g-yogs /

original: snang ba'i phyir phyogs su btang /
analyzed: snang ba'i phyir phyogs su btang /

original: ltag ma ltar g-yogs pa mun pa gnag na mdo mdor bu ga gdod /
analyzed: ltag ma ltar g-yogs pa mun pa gnag na mdo mdor bu ga gdod /
translated: If it is covered like a roof and is dark, windows should be made.

original: de med na ki ta ka'am re ldes so //
analyzed: de med na ki ta ka'am re ldes so //
translated: If that is not possible, it should be covered with kitaka or reed.

original: spang leb kyis g-yog tu med na dpar ram re ldes g-yogs /
analyzed: spang leb kyis g-yog tu med na dpar ram re ldes g-yogs /
translated: If a mat is not available, a blanket or a mat made of reeds is used.

original: dbyar gyi zla ba bzhi'i tha mar dbyung /
analyzed: dbyar gyi zla ba bzhi'i tha mar dbyung /

analyzed: dge 'dun gyi bkad sa zlum por bya / gnas grang ba'i phyi logs rtsig pa sbyin /
translated: The assembly‚Äôs courtyard should be circular.üîΩThe courtyard of the assembly should be circular.üîΩIn cold regions, the outer wall is extended.

analyzed: bkad sa grang ba'i phyir rgyab thog thag tu rtsig pas bskor ka ba phreng du'o //

analyzed: mdun thog thag tu ka ba phreng bar gzugs skar khung gdod /

analyzed: dge slong gnyis gsum tsam 'dug pa'i mdo mdor skar khung gdod /

original: stan gyi yang thog dang de'i 'og tu mu mnyam par bya /
analyzed: stan gyi yang thog dang de'i 'og tu mu mnyam par bya /
translated: The upper and lower parts of the seat are made even.

original: ltag mar skar khung gdod pa ha cang mi mtho bar stan gor chad tsam nas yan chad du gzugs /
analyzed: ltag mar skar khung gdod pa ha cang mi mtho bar stan gor chad tsam nas yan chad du gzugs /
translated: The window is placed in the upper part of the wall. It is not too high. It is placed from the edge of the round seat and above.üîΩA door and a lattice are inserted.

original: dra ba can dang @331b sgo leb gzhug / skar khud de la sgo leb dang dra bas bre /
analyzed: dra ba can dang @331b sgo leb gzhug / skar khud de la sgo leb dang dra bas bre /
translated: The window is covered with a door and a lattice.

original: bza' ba'i dang me'i dang 'du ba'i dang 'chag pa'i gnas bya /
analyzed: bza' ba'i dang me'i dang 'du ba'i dang 'chag pa'i gnas bya /
translated: One should make a place for eating, a place for fire, a place for gathering, and a place for walking.

original: ming gis smos pa 'di rnams kyi gnas khang bya /
analyzed: ming gis smos pa 'di rnams kyi gnas khang bya /
translated: One should make a dwelling place for those mentioned by name.

original: glo phyogs zhar bar g-yogs pa bya /
analyzed: glo phyogs zhar bar g-yogs pa bya /
translated: One should cover the side of a wall.

original: dge slong gtsug lag khang ma zin gyi bar du rtsig pa la bcar la steng rtsas g-yogs pa'i khyim byas la der gnas /
analyzed: dge slong gtsug lag khang ma zin gyi bar du rtsig pa la bcar la steng rtsas g-yogs pa'i khyim byas la der gnas /

original: sa phug kyang brtags pa'o //
analyzed: sa phug kyang brtags pa'o //

original: phug na gnas kyang nyes med /
analyzed: phug na gnas kyang nyes med /

original: ba gam kyang ngo //
analyzed: ba gam kyang ngo //

analyzed: rtsig pa'i glo la ba gam 'dra bar byas te steng g-yogs pa'i khung bur gnas kyang nyes med /

original: khyams bzhin du deng be ri ka'ang chud do //
analyzed: khyams bzhin du deng be ri ka'ang chud do //
translated: Also, a veranda.

original: rtsig pa'i bu gur shing bcug la shing gi steng du shing leb kyis bres te shing leb kyi mdo dang ka ba gnyis su mi ltung ba'i phyir lcags kyi gzer bus gdab /

original: ra bas bskor ba rab tu byung ba'i kun dga' yang ngo //
analyzed: ra bas bskor ba rab tu byung ba'i kun dga' yang ngo //
translated: Also, a courtyard.

original: gtsug lag khang gi khor yug tu ra ba brtsigs na'ang nyes med /
analyzed: gtsug lag khang gi khor yug tu ra ba brtsigs na'ang nyes med /
translated: It is also not a downfall if you build a wall around the temple.

original: rtsig pa la stor khung gdod pa yang ngo //
analyzed: rtsig pa la stor khung gdod pa yang ngo //
translated: It is also not a downfall if you build a window in the wall.

original: ra ba la chu 'gro zhing mi 'khyil pa'i phyir mdo mdor stor khung gdod do //
analyzed: ra ba la chu 'gro zhing mi 'khyil pa'i phyir mdo mdor stor khung gdod do //
translated: You should build windows in the wall at intervals so that water will not collect and overflow.

original: sab mo dang 'bos kyis kyang ngo //
analyzed: sab mo dang 'bos kyis kyang ngo //
translated: You may also build a fence and a moat.

original: ra bas gtsug lag khang bskor ba bzhin du sab mo dang 'obs kyis bskor kyang rung ngo //
analyzed: ra bas gtsug lag khang bskor ba bzhin du sab mo dang 'obs kyis bskor kyang rung ngo //
translated: It is also acceptable to build a fence and a moat around the temple instead of a wall.

original: gang zag la gtsug lag khang 'khor dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: gang zag la gtsug lag khang 'khor dang bcas pa'o //
translated: The person who is the object of the action is the monk to whom the temple is offered.

original: ltag tu gtsug lag khang brtsig pa'i rnams lta bur yon bdag gcig gis thams cad brtsigs te dge slong gcig la yon du phul ba'ang len du dbang ngo //
analyzed: ltag tu gtsug lag khang brtsig pa'i rnams lta bur yon bdag gcig gis thams cad brtsigs te dge slong gcig la yon du phul ba'ang len du dbang ngo //
translated: It is also acceptable to offer a temple to a monk if the temple and its grounds were built by a single patron.

original: thams cad sngon po la sogs pa'i mtshan ma mngon sum pa'i phyir mal khang gi rtsig pa sngon po la sogs pa sna bzhir bya /
analyzed: thams cad sngon po la sogs pa'i mtshan ma mngon sum pa'i phyir mal khang gi rtsig pa sngon po la sogs pa sna bzhir bya /
translated: The temple should have four corners, and the walls should be painted blue or some other color, because the Buddha has said that the temple should have the appearance of a celestial mansion.

original: dge slong bsam gtan byed pa la la ser po la dmigs la la dkar po la dmigs la la dmar po la dmigs la la sngon po la dmigs pas bdag gis nyal khang ngos bzhir tshon sna bzhis bskus la dge slong mtshan ma gang la dmigs pa de
analyzed: dge slong bsam gtan byed pa la la ser po la dmigs la la dkar po la dmigs la la dmar po la dmigs la la sngon po la dmigs pas bdag gis nyal khang ngos bzhir tshon sna bzhis bskus la dge slong mtshan ma gang la dmigs pa de
translated: Some monks who practice meditation focus on yellow, some on white, some on red, and some on blue. Therefore, I will paint the walls of the sleeping quarters with the four colors.

original: la bsam gtan byed cing bsgom /
analyzed: la bsam gtan byed cing bsgom /
translated: The monks will meditate and cultivate concentration on whatever sign they focus on.

original: rab tu byung ba'i kun dga' bris pa'ang brtags pa'o //
analyzed: rab tu byung ba'i kun dga' bris pa'ang brtags pa'o //
translated: It is also permissible to draw a pleasure grove for the monks.

original: ra ba dang khyams la sogs pa'ang ri mo 'drir gnang ba'o //
analyzed: ra ba dang khyams la sogs pa'ang ri mo 'drir gnang ba'o //
translated: It is also permissible to draw a fence, a courtyard, and so forth.

original: sgor gnod sbyin bris te lag na rdo rje la sogs pa thogs pa'o //
analyzed: sgor gnod sbyin bris te lag na rdo rje la sogs pa thogs pa'o //
translated: At the gate, draw yakshas holding a vajra and so forth.

original: dge slong so so'i khyim bu'i sgo g-yas g-yon du gnod sbyin gyi gzugs bris la lag na rdo rje'am mtshon cha thogs pa bris /
analyzed: dge slong so so'i khyim bu'i sgo g-yas g-yon du gnod sbyin gyi gzugs bris la lag na rdo rje'am mtshon cha thogs pa bris /
translated: Draw the forms of yakshas holding a vajra or a weapon to the right and left of the door of each monk's hut.

original: sgo khang du 'khor ba'i 'khor lo rgyud lnga bya /
analyzed: sgo khang du 'khor ba'i 'khor lo rgyud lnga bya /
translated: In the gateway, draw the wheel of samsara with the five lineages.

original: gtsug lag khang @332a * //
analyzed: gtsug lag khang @332a * //
translated: In the temple

original: sgo'i khang du lam rgyud lngar 'khor ba'i 'khor lo bris /
analyzed: sgo'i khang du lam rgyud lngar 'khor ba'i 'khor lo bris /
translated: In the gateway, draw the wheel of samsara with the five lineages.

original: ltag tu lha dang mi'o //
analyzed: ltag tu lha dang mi'o //
translated: Behind, draw gods and humans.

original: lam rgyud lnga la steng du lha dang mi bri /
analyzed: lam rgyud lnga la steng du lha dang mi bri /
translated: On the path, above, draw the gods and humans;

original: 'og tu ngan song gsum bri /
analyzed: 'og tu ngan song gsum bri /

original: gling bzhi yang ngo //
analyzed: gling bzhi yang ngo //

analyzed: ltag tu mi'i khams bri bar gling bzhi'ang der bri /

analyzed: 'khor lo rgyud lnga bris pa'i 'khor yug tu rgyu rkyen bcu gnyis skye zhing 'khor ba'i rgyud bri /
translated: On the outer rim of the wheel with the five paths, draw the twelve links of dependent origination, the cause of birth and circling.

analyzed: 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang gti mug dbus su phug ron dang sprul dang phag lta bur ro //
translated: In the center, draw a pigeon, snake, and pig to represent desire, hatred, and delusion.

analyzed: 'khor lo dbus su 'di gsum gyi gzugs bris te phug ron ni 'dod chags /
translated: In the center of the wheel, draw the forms of these three: a pigeon for desire,

original: sbrul ni zhe sdang phag ni gti mug go //
analyzed: sbrul ni zhe sdang phag ni gti mug go //
translated: a snake for hatred, and a pig for delusion.

original: glen pas snga ma dag mid pa lta bur ro //
analyzed: glen pas snga ma dag mid pa lta bur ro //
translated: Like a fool swallowing a hook,

analyzed: ltag ma ltar bris pa la phag gis phug ron dang sbrul gnyis med pa ltar byas kha gzhag / rkyen du 'tshogs te byung ba'i yan lag kho ra khor yug tu'o //
translated: The limbs are arranged in a circle, arising from the coming together of conditions.

original: ma rig pa nas rga shi'i bar du 'khor ba'i rgyud yi ger bris /
analyzed: ma rig pa nas rga shi'i bar du 'khor ba'i rgyud yi ger bris /
translated: From ignorance up to old age and death, the continuum of samsara is written in letters.

analyzed: de dag thams cad mi rtag pas mid pa lta bu'o //
translated: All of these are like a swallowed [object] because of impermanence.

original: gnod sbyin lta bu'i gzugs shig bris la de khams gsum dang lam rgyud drug thams cad mid pa lta bur bya /
analyzed: gnod sbyin lta bu'i gzugs shig bris la de khams gsum dang lam rgyud drug thams cad mid pa lta bur bya /

analyzed: ya rol du sangs rgyas mya ngan las 'das pa'i dkyil 'khor dkar po mngon par ston par ro //

analyzed: 'khor lo'i ltag tu sangs rgyas kyi gzugs shig bris la de'i g-yas phyogs su dkyil 'khor la ston pa dang 'dra ba bris te su 'khor ba las 'da' bar 'dod na 'phags pa'i lam brgyad sbyangs na mya ngan las 'da' ba'i lam 'dir 'gro'o zhes bstan pa 'dra
translated: Draw a form of the Buddha above the wheel, and to its right, draw one like the teacher pointing to the mandala, indicating, If one wishes to transcend samsara, if one trains in the eightfold noble path, one goes to this path of nirvana.

analyzed: bar bri / tshigs su bcad pa tshol cig ces pa dang gnyis 'og tu'o //
translated: The two lines, ‚ÄúThe one who seeks the verses‚Äù and so on, are below.

analyzed: sangs rgyas bzhugs pa'i drung na mar so sor thar pa'i smad dra la /
translated: In the presence of the Buddha, at the end of the Pratimok·π£a,üîΩthe two sides of the wall are written with the verse:

original: rtsa khyim pa la glang gis sa //

analyzed: bar du lo gsum gyis chod na gnas brtan man chad gang yang stan gcig la 'dug tu rung ngo //

analyzed: lo bzhi lon na lhan cig tu 'dug tu mi rung ngo //

analyzed: grong bar du mkhan po dang yang stan med na dran pa bzhag ste spyad /

analyzed: khang bu'ang khyim pa dang ma yin /

translated: If she enters the temple like a wild animal, the monks should ask her, ‚ÄúNun, are you angry with the monks?‚Äù If she says, ‚ÄúI‚Äôm not angry,‚Äù they should give her permission to enter.

original: dri bas ma 'khon par chad par shes nas so //
analyzed: dri bas ma 'khon par chad par shes nas so //
translated: If she is not angry, they should let her in after asking.

original: dge slong 'khon med par shes na dri mi dgos par gtang ngo //
analyzed: dge slong 'khon med par shes na dri mi dgos par gtang ngo //
translated: If she is not angry with the monks, they should let her in without asking.

original: rgyab gtan dang gtan bu dang zung nga dang lde mig can dang gzer gtan gyis gtsug lag khang bsdam par bsgo //
analyzed: rgyab gtan dang gtan bu dang zung nga dang lde mig can dang gzer gtan gyis gtsug lag khang bsdam par bsgo //
translated: The temple should be locked with a back-lock, a bolt, a crossbar, a key, or a nail-lock.

original: dge slong pho mo'i gtsug lag khang gi sgo chen po'i ming gis smos pa 'di rnams kyi gtan pas bsdam /
analyzed: dge slong pho mo'i gtsug lag khang gi sgo chen po'i ming gis smos pa 'di rnams kyi gtan pas bsdam /
translated: The names of the main doors of the monasteries of the monks and nuns are mentioned here.

original: phye ma red @338b gtsug lag khang skyong gis brtags te sgo gcad /
analyzed: phye ma red @338b gtsug lag khang skyong gis brtags te sgo gcad /
translated: The monastery caretaker should check the doors at dawn and close them.

original: nyi ma nub na sgo bcad la gra grar rkun po yod par dogs pa'i sa kun btsal /
analyzed: nyi ma nub na sgo bcad la gra grar rkun po yod par dogs pa'i sa kun btsal /
translated: If the sun has set, the doors should be closed and the monastery searched for thieves.

original: 'jigs pa dang bcas na mel tshe pas mel tshe bya /
analyzed: 'jigs pa dang bcas na mel tshe pas mel tshe bya /
translated: If there is danger, the night watchmen should keep watch.

original: gtsug lag khang na dge slong 'jigs par gyur na mel tshe bya /
analyzed: gtsug lag khang na dge slong 'jigs par gyur na mel tshe bya /
translated: If a monk in the monastery is in danger, the night watchmen should keep watch.

original: der gyur nas nyal zhing ting nge 'dzin dang bcas pa mi bya /
analyzed: der gyur nas nyal zhing ting nge 'dzin dang bcas pa mi bya /
translated: Having done that, they should not sleep or be inattentive.

original: ltag ma ltar mel tshe bskos pa'i dge slong mel tshe byed pa'i bsam gtan dang nyal du mi dbang /
analyzed: ltag ma ltar mel tshe bskos pa'i dge slong mel tshe byed pa'i bsam gtan dang nyal du mi dbang /
translated: The monk appointed as night watchman should not be able to sleep or concentrate on his meditation.

original: cho ga 'di dag byas nas gtsug lag khang skyong la dge 'dun gyi gnas brtan gyis dri /
analyzed: cho ga 'di dag byas nas gtsug lag khang skyong la dge 'dun gyi gnas brtan gyis dri /
translated: Having performed these rituals, the most senior monk of the monastery should ask the monastery caretaker.

original: gtsug lag khang gi gnas brtan gyis gtsug lag khang skyong la lhag ma'i las rnams ltar byas sam ma byas dri /
analyzed: gtsug lag khang gi gnas brtan gyis gtsug lag khang skyong la lhag ma'i las rnams ltar byas sam ma byas dri /
translated: The most senior monk of the monastery should ask the monastery caretaker whether the remaining duties have been done or not.

original: gtsug lag khang nas 'on te ma bcings par stor na gtsug lag khang skyong gis du nyes pa de snyed kyi cha sbyin /
analyzed: gtsug lag khang nas 'on te ma bcings par stor na gtsug lag khang skyong gis du nyes pa de snyed kyi cha sbyin /
translated: If it is lost without being bound in the temple, the temple caretaker must pay a portion of the fine.

original: gtsug lag khang phyi sgo gtsug lag khang skyong gis gtan pa rnam lngas bsdams pa las nang nas nor zhig stor na gtsug lag khang skyong la skyin pa mi 'bab /
analyzed: gtsug lag khang phyi sgo gtsug lag khang skyong gis gtan pa rnam lngas bsdams pa las nang nas nor zhig stor na gtsug lag khang skyong la skyin pa mi 'bab /
translated: If something is lost from inside the temple, which is locked with the five locks of the temple caretaker, the temple caretaker is not liable for the loss.

original: gtan pa gsum bcug na skyin pa lnga gnyis bab ste /
analyzed: gtan pa gsum bcug na skyin pa lnga gnyis bab ste /
translated: If three locks are put on, the fine is two-fifths.

original: de bzhin du rim bzhin du bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du rim bzhin du bya'o //
translated: This should be applied in the same way in order.

original: lcags kyu dang tha ram bcang /
analyzed: lcags kyu dang tha ram bcang /
translated: Carry a key and a lock.

original: gang zag gi gnas khang la tha ram dang lcags kyu ni rdzas mi stor ba'i phyir bcang /
analyzed: gang zag gi gnas khang la tha ram dang lcags kyu ni rdzas mi stor ba'i phyir bcang /
translated: In the dwelling of a person, a lock and a key are carried in order to prevent the loss of property.

original: sgo bcing ba yod pa'am bcings kyi bar du mi 'gro //
analyzed: sgo bcing ba yod pa'am bcings kyi bar du mi 'gro //
translated: One does not go beyond the locked door or until it is locked.

original: gtsug lag khang skyong gis sgo lcags dang gtan pa ma bcug par 'phyan du mi 'gro //
analyzed: gtsug lag khang skyong gis sgo lcags dang gtan pa ma bcug par 'phyan du mi 'gro //
translated: The temple caretaker does not go out without locking the door and putting on the seal.

original: gnas stong par zhugs na 'dir chag chag la sogs pa bya /
analyzed: gnas stong par zhugs na 'dir chag chag la sogs pa bya /
translated: If one enters an empty house, one should sprinkle water, etc.

original: dge slong zhig gud nas 'ongs te gtsug lag khang bur 'dug na khang bu phyag dar dang chag chag byas pa gnas so //
analyzed: dge slong zhig gud nas 'ongs te gtsug lag khang bur 'dug na khang bu phyag dar dang chag chag byas pa gnas so //
translated: If a monk comes from somewhere else and the temple is dirty, he should sweep and sprinkle it.

original: snod dag so so'i gnas so //
analyzed: snod dag so so'i gnas so //
translated: The vessels should be in their proper places.üîΩIf there is a previous user of the temple, he should not be harmed.

original: khang bu de na dge 'dun gyi spyad sngon yod na ma snad par gzhag / de byug par rigs na yang ngo //
analyzed: khang bu de na dge 'dun gyi spyad sngon yod na ma snad par gzhag / de byug par rigs na yang ngo //
translated: If it is proper to anoint it, he should do so.

original: lhag ma dge 'dun gyi spyad rnams bkru ba dang dus dus su bskam par bya /
analyzed: lhag ma dge 'dun gyi spyad rnams bkru ba dang dus dus su bskam par bya /
translated: The remaining things used by the Sa·πÖgha should be washed and dried from time to time.üîΩIf there is a caretaker, he should put the green grass in the bird cage.üîΩIf there is a monk or a layman, he should put the green grass in the temple or in the vicinity of the st≈´pa.

original: de ste rtog pa byed pa yod na rtsva sngon po la bye'u gzhug / dge sbyong ngam khyim pa yod na gtsug lag khang mchod rten gyi 'khor na rtsva sngon po yod pa thog tu gzhug / de ste 'di khyim gyi 'ongs na 'di la chos kyi gtam
analyzed: de ste rtog pa byed pa yod na rtsva sngon po la bye'u gzhug / dge sbyong ngam khyim pa yod na gtsug lag khang mchod rten gyi 'khor na rtsva sngon po yod pa thog tu gzhug / de ste 'di khyim gyi 'ongs na 'di la chos kyi gtam
translated: If a householder comes, he should be given a Dharma talk.

original: dang gzhan phod pa'i chos bya /
analyzed: dang gzhan phod pa'i chos bya /
translated: If another person comes, he should be given the Dharma.

original: dge slong gung nas gtsug lag khang du phyin te khyim pa 'phrad du dga' ste gan du 'ongs @339a * //
analyzed: dge slong gung nas gtsug lag khang du phyin te khyim pa 'phrad du dga' ste gan du 'ongs @339a * //
translated: If a monk goes from the temple to the temple and meets a householder, he should be happy and go to him.

original: na chos bshad pa dang kha zas ci bdog pas mgu bar bya /
analyzed: na chos bshad pa dang kha zas ci bdog pas mgu bar bya /
translated: One should please them with Dharma teachings and whatever food and wealth one has.

original: shing bskyed pa ma brtags pa ma brtags pa ma yin no //
analyzed: shing bskyed pa ma brtags pa ma brtags pa ma yin no //
translated: It is not the case that one should not examine the tree that one has planted.

original: gtsug lag khang gi 'khor du dge slong gis skyed shing skyed du gnang ngo //
analyzed: gtsug lag khang gi 'khor du dge slong gis skyed shing skyed du gnang ngo //
translated: A monk should plant a tree in the courtyard of a temple.

original: 'di bskyed nas mi bsrung bar mi bya /
analyzed: 'di bskyed nas mi bsrung bar mi bya /
translated: After planting it, one should not neglect it.

original: ltag ma ltar shing bskyed nas yal bar mi dor bar bsrung /
analyzed: ltag ma ltar shing bskyed nas yal bar mi dor bar bsrung /
translated: One should protect it as if it were one's own head.

analyzed: ma bsrungs na nyes byas / nam me tog gi bar du shing la'o //
translated: If one neglects it, one commits an offense of wrong conduct.üîΩOne should protect the tree until it bears flowers.

original: me tog gi shing zhig yin nam me tog chags pa'i bar du bsrung /
analyzed: me tog gi shing zhig yin nam me tog chags pa'i bar du bsrung /
translated: If it is a flowering tree, one should protect it until it has flowers.

original: gzhan na 'bras bu'i bar du'o //
analyzed: gzhan na 'bras bu'i bar du'o //
translated: If it is another kind of tree, one should protect it until it bears fruit.

original: shing de 'bras bu skye ba yin na 'bras bu chags kyi bar du bsrung /
analyzed: shing de 'bras bu skye ba yin na 'bras bu chags kyi bar du bsrung /
translated: If the tree bears fruit, one should protect it until it has fruit.

original: ring na lo lngar ro //
analyzed: ring na lo lngar ro //
translated: If it is a long-lived tree, one should protect it for five years.

original: ltag ma'i shing gnyis grib ma la bskyed de 'bras bu dang / me tog ma byung na lo lnga tshun chad du bsrung /
analyzed: ltag ma'i shing gnyis grib ma la bskyed de 'bras bu dang / me tog ma byung na lo lnga tshun chad du bsrung /
translated: If the tree is a long-lived tree, one should plant it in the shade of another tree and protect it for five years until it has flowers and fruit.

original: bdag bzhin pa ni dge slong gzhan la bcol na'o //
analyzed: bdag bzhin pa ni dge slong gzhan la bcol na'o //
translated: If one is unable to do so, one should entrust it to another monk.

original: bdag gud du 'gro bar 'gyur na grogs dge slong zhig na re ngas bsrung ngo zhes zer na bcol te song yang nyes med /üîΩrkang pa bkru ba dang so shing bza' ba dang lhung bzed bkru ba dang / khrus dag gi glud /
analyzed: bdag gud du 'gro bar 'gyur na grogs dge slong zhig na re ngas bsrung ngo zhes zer na bcol te song yang nyes med / rkang pa bkru ba dang so shing bza' ba dang lhung bzed bkru ba dang / khrus dag gi glud /
translated: If you are going away for a while, it is permissible to entrust your bowl to a fellow monk who will look after it, even though he is not a relative.üîΩYou should not wash your feet, use a tooth cleaner, or wash your begging bowl in the vicinity of a tree that is the abode of a spirit.

original: skyed shing de dag la so shing bza' ba dang rkang pa bkru ba dang lhung bzed bkru ba skye shing gi rtsa ba'i drung du bkrus na shing skye ba la phan no //
analyzed: skyed shing de dag la so shing bza' ba dang rkang pa bkru ba dang lhung bzed bkru ba skye shing gi rtsa ba'i drung du bkrus na shing skye ba la phan no //
translated: If you wash your feet, use a tooth cleaner, or wash your begging bowl at the foot of such a tree, it will harm the tree.

original: de la snying pos khyim grang ba dgag pa'i phyir bya /
analyzed: de la snying pos khyim grang ba dgag pa'i phyir bya /
translated: You should not use the heartwood of such a tree to block a cold wind.

original: skye shing de grang bar gyur na kho ra khor yug tu rtsig pas brtsigs te dro bar bya /
analyzed: skye shing de grang bar gyur na kho ra khor yug tu rtsig pas brtsigs te dro bar bya /

analyzed: 'di srung ba'i phyir skar khung gdod / ltag ma ltar rtsig pas bskor ba mdo mdor bu gu gdod /

original: g-yogs ma sbyin shing de grang ba'i dus na steng nas sab mos g-yogs /
analyzed: g-yogs ma sbyin shing de grang ba'i dus na steng nas sab mos g-yogs /
translated: You should not cover it with a roof. If the tree becomes cold, you should cover it with a blanket.

original: dpyid bsil ba'i phyir bshu /
analyzed: dpyid bsil ba'i phyir bshu /
translated: In the spring, you should uncover it to cool it down.

original: ltag ma ltar g-yogs pa dpyid dro ba'i tshe slar bshu /
analyzed: ltag ma ltar g-yogs pa dpyid dro ba'i tshe slar bshu /
translated: When the roof is covered like a roof, it is removed again in the warm spring.

original: sngon gyi dbyar gyi mi rul ba'i phyir ba yang ngo //
analyzed: sngon gyi dbyar gyi mi rul ba'i phyir ba yang ngo //
translated: The old summer roof is also removed to prevent rotting.

original: rtag tu skyed shing la rtsig pas bskor ba'i dus la slar gzhi /
analyzed: rtag tu skyed shing la rtsig pas bskor ba'i dus la slar gzhi /
translated: When the time comes to build a wall around the tree, it is rebuilt again.

original: chu khung gdod /
analyzed: chu khung gdod /
translated: The water channel is newly made.

original: ltag ma'i khang bu ma bshig pa'i tshe chu 'dzag pa'i chu khung gdod /
analyzed: ltag ma'i khang bu ma bshig pa'i tshe chu 'dzag pa'i chu khung gdod /
translated: When the roof of the upper story is not destroyed, the water channel that leaks water is newly made.

original: rtsa ba'i rgyud la g-yel bar mi bya /
analyzed: rtsa ba'i rgyud la g-yel bar mi bya /
translated: Do not neglect the main text.

original: skyed shing gi rtsa ba dang gsher dang la phug la sogs pa'i mi gu la mi g-yel bar bsrung /
analyzed: skyed shing gi rtsa ba dang gsher dang la phug la sogs pa'i mi gu la mi g-yel bar bsrung /
translated: Do not neglect to protect the roots, moisture, and garlic of the tree, etc.

original: 'khor so sor bgos te bcos /
analyzed: 'khor so sor bgos te bcos /
translated: The assembly is divided into individual groups and repaired.üîΩIf many trees are planted and cannot be reached by the hands of a single monk, many nuns are appointed and made to plant them.

original: shing skyed shing mang du bskyed de dge slong gcig @339b gi lag gis mi khyab na dge slong ma mang nyung la bskos te bskyed du gzhug / la la so shing za ba dang la la kha 'khru ba dang la la rkang pa de la sogs pa ste
analyzed: shing skyed shing mang du bskyed de dge slong gcig @339b gi lag gis mi khyab na dge slong ma mang nyung la bskos te bskyed du gzhug / la la so shing za ba dang la la kha 'khru ba dang la la rkang pa de la sogs pa ste
translated: Some chew tooth wood, some rinse their mouths, some wash their feet, and so on.

original: rgyun du ma yin /
analyzed: rgyun du ma yin /
translated: It is not done continuously.

original: ltag ma ltar shing bskyed na bdag gi dge ba btang la shing 'ba' zhig bskyed pa ma yin gyi shing drung la lar so shing bza' zhing rkang lag bkru ba'i chu blugs /
analyzed: ltag ma ltar shing bskyed na bdag gi dge ba btang la shing 'ba' zhig bskyed pa ma yin gyi shing drung la lar so shing bza' zhing rkang lag bkru ba'i chu blugs /
translated: In some places under the tree, you should chew tooth wood and pour water for washing your hands and feet.

original: la las lhung bzed bkru ba'i chu blugs /
analyzed: la las lhung bzed bkru ba'i chu blugs /
translated: In some places, you should pour water for washing the begging bowl.

original: me tog dang 'bras bu bsrung ba'i phyir dge slong la bsgo /
analyzed: me tog dang 'bras bu bsrung ba'i phyir dge slong la bsgo /
translated: In order to protect the flowers and fruit, you should request the monks to guard the tree.

analyzed: ltag ma ltar skyed shing bskyed de dpyid me tog skyes pa dang ston 'bras bu chags par gyur na dge 'dun gyis dge slong gcig srung mar bsko /
translated: If you plant a tree like a head ornament, in spring the tree will produce flowers and in autumn it will bear fruit. The community of monks should appoint one monk to guard the tree.

original: zas kyi dus kyi phyir gzhan gyis so //
analyzed: zas kyi dus kyi phyir gzhan gyis so //
translated: For the sake of the time of eating, others should guard it.

original: ltag ma ltar bsrungs pa'i dge slong zan za ba'i tshe dge 'dun gyis dge slong gzhan cig bskos te brje /
analyzed: ltag ma ltar bsrungs pa'i dge slong zan za ba'i tshe dge 'dun gyis dge slong gzhan cig bskos te brje /
translated: When the monk who guards the tree like a head ornament eats, the community of monks should appoint another monk to replace him.

original: thog ma nyid du zos te der 'gro /üîΩrjed ma'i dge 'dun phal pas kyang sngar zan bza'/
analyzed: thog ma nyid du zos te der 'gro / rjed ma'i dge 'dun phal pas kyang sngar zan bza'/
translated: He should go there after he has eaten first.üîΩThe ordinary monks who are not the guardians should eat their meal first.

analyzed: srung ma'i dge slong ni dge slong phal dang thabs shig tu bza'/
translated: The monk who is the guardian should eat together with the ordinary monks.

original: klog tu 'jug pa g-yogs mang du byed pa dang mi phod pa la snying rje bar bya /
analyzed: klog tu 'jug pa g-yogs mang du byed pa dang mi phod pa la snying rje bar bya /
translated: One should have compassion for those who are not able to read, for those who have many duties, and for those who are not courageous.

analyzed: mkhan po la slob ma mang du bdog na mkhan po la gang bsti stang che ba'i dge slong dang myur du mi ldog cing shes rab chung ba la mkhan pos snying nas bslab po //
translated: If the preceptor has many disciples, the preceptor should sincerely train the monk who has the greatest respect for him, who will not quickly turn away, and who has little wisdom.

analyzed: dge slong ma de'i 'dul ba 'dzin pa dang de cha nod pa la klog las snying rje bya /
translated: One should have compassion for the nuns who uphold the monastic code and for those who are studying it, since the nuns have less wisdom than the monks.

analyzed: dge slong ma dge slong pha bas shes rab chung bas so sor thar pa la sogs pa kha don dang mang du slob mi nus /
translated: They are unable to recite the PrƒÅtimok·π£a and so forth, and to train in many things.

original: gyi na mi gtong bar snying rje'i phyir yun ring du bslab po //
analyzed: gyi na mi gtong bar snying rje'i phyir yun ring du bslab po //
translated: One should train them for a long time out of compassion, without being lazy.

original: spring yig bri /
analyzed: spring yig bri /
translated: One should write letters.

original: dharma dang spring yig brir gnang /
analyzed: dharma dang spring yig brir gnang /
translated: One should allow the writing of letters and the Dharma.

original: dran par mi nus na gzung ba'i phyir 'dul ba yang ngo //
analyzed: dran par mi nus na gzung ba'i phyir 'dul ba yang ngo //
translated: If one is unable to remember, in order to retain it, one should also write the monastic code.

original: chos 'chad pa nyan pa las khong du mi chud na rjed byang la bris te bslabs kyang nyes med /
analyzed: chos 'chad pa nyan pa las khong du mi chud na rjed byang la bris te bslabs kyang nyes med /
translated: If one does not understand the Dharma from listening to the explanation, one should write it down in a memorandum and study it. There is no fault in that.

original: 'bri mi 'bri'o //
analyzed: 'bri mi 'bri'o //
translated: One should not write it.

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos gang yang gang zag gis 'drir ni mi gnang gi kha thon du slob shig / dge 'dun gyis ni 'drir gnang ngo //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos gang yang gang zag gis 'drir ni mi gnang gi kha thon du slob shig / dge 'dun gyis ni 'drir gnang ngo //
translated: One should not allow a person to write any of the Buddha‚Äôs teachings, but one should study them by recitation. The Sa·πÖgha is allowed to write them.

original: de bzhin du 'dis so sor thar pa yang ngo //
analyzed: de bzhin du 'dis so sor thar pa yang ngo //
translated: In the same way, this is also the case with the PrƒÅtimok·π£a.

original: so sor thar pa yang gang zag gis yi ge la mi bri bar kha don du mi bslab po //üîΩde dang 'dra ba yang ngo //
analyzed: so sor thar pa yang gang zag gis yi ge la mi bri bar kha don du mi bslab po // de dang 'dra ba yang ngo //
translated: One should not study the PrƒÅtimok·π£a by recitation without writing it down.

original: phi bang ka la sogs pa gzhan kyang mi bri bar kha @340a * //
analyzed: phi bang ka la sogs pa gzhan kyang mi bri bar kha @340a * //
translated: This is also the case with the other texts, such as the P≈´rvava·πÅ≈õa.üîΩOne should not write them, but study them by recitation.

original: thon bya / gang zag dag kyang ngo //
analyzed: thon bya / gang zag dag kyang ngo //
translated: This is also the case with the persons.

original: gang zag gi gos kyi mtha' dang rgya la ming rus mi bri /
analyzed: gang zag gi gos kyi mtha' dang rgya la ming rus mi bri /
translated: One should not write the name and clan on the edge or the seal of the robe of a person.

original: mtshan mar byed pa ni nyes med do //
analyzed: mtshan mar byed pa ni nyes med do //
translated: It is not a fault to make a sign.

original: gos kyi mtha' ma la snag tsa'i tig ti dang mtshan ma btab pa nyes med /üîΩdge 'dun gyi mal stan la mi bri /
analyzed: gos kyi mtha' ma la snag tsa'i tig ti dang mtshan ma btab pa nyes med / dge 'dun gyi mal stan la mi bri /
translated: It is not a fault to put a drop of ink or make a sign on the edge of a robe.üîΩOne should not write on the bedding of the Sa·πÖgha.

original: dge 'dun gyi mal stan la dge 'dun gyi mal stan no zhes yi ger mi bri /
analyzed: dge 'dun gyi mal stan la dge 'dun gyi mal stan no zhes yi ger mi bri /
