translated: One should place this as an offering. One should always make offerings to the stupa on the day of the Buddha's birth.

original: skyes pa dang / cod pan dang gtsug tor dang byang chub pa'i gtsug tor dang byang chub pa'i mchod ston bdag gis ming gis smos pa 'di rnams kyi dus gsum rtag par mchod rten dang sku gzugs mchod par bya /
analyzed: skyes pa dang / cod pan dang gtsug tor dang byang chub pa'i gtsug tor dang byang chub pa'i mchod ston bdag gis ming gis smos pa 'di rnams kyi dus gsum rtag par mchod rten dang sku gzugs mchod par bya /
translated: One should always make offerings to the stupa and images of these, the crown, the u·π£·πáƒ´·π£a, the u·π£·πáƒ´·π£a of enlightenment, and the feast of enlightenment, which are mentioned by name, in the three times.

original: grong khyer 'jug par 'dir bya ba yong ngo //
analyzed: grong khyer 'jug par 'dir bya ba yong ngo //
translated: One should do this when entering the city.

original: khang bu rtseg ma'i gan du mchod rten gzhag la yul bskor bar bya /
analyzed: khang bu rtseg ma'i gan du mchod rten gzhag la yul bskor bar bya /
translated: One should place the stupa near the multi-storied house and circumambulate the country.

original: dge slong gis bskur ba brtags pa'o //
analyzed: dge slong gis bskur ba brtags pa'o //
translated: This is the examination of what is sent by a monk.

original: ltag ma ltar yul bskor ba dge slong bzhis me khang yang nyes med /
analyzed: ltag ma ltar yul bskor ba dge slong bzhis me khang yang nyes med /
translated: Like the one who turns his head, the one who turns his country is the four monks who are not at fault in the fire house.

original: 'di'i tshe gsar bus so //
analyzed: 'di'i tshe gsar bus so //
translated: At this time, the young man did it.

original: ltag ma ltar bskur ba dge slong gzhon nus bskur ro //
analyzed: ltag ma ltar bskur ba dge slong gzhon nus bskur ro //
translated: Like the one who turns his head, the one who turns it is the young monk who turns it.

original: sde lngas 'khor sbyin /
analyzed: sde lngas 'khor sbyin /
translated: The five sects give the retinue.

original: yul bskor ba'i tshe dge slong sde lngas mchod cing 'khor bya'o //
analyzed: yul bskor ba'i tshe dge slong sde lngas mchod cing 'khor bya'o //
translated: When turning the country, the five sects of monks should worship and turn it.

original: yon rgan rims kyis blang ngo //
analyzed: yon rgan rims kyis blang ngo //
translated: The old donors take it.

original: ltag ma ltar yul bskor ba'i tshe mchod rten la yon phul na mi khyams par bya ba'i phyir dge slong rgan pos blang /
analyzed: ltag ma ltar yul bskor ba'i tshe mchod rten la yon phul na mi khyams par bya ba'i phyir dge slong rgan pos blang /
translated: When turning the country like the one who turns his head, if offerings are made to the stupa, in order to avoid being carried away, the old monk takes it.

original: gsil dkrol ba dang gzhan yang dge ba'i bkur sti chen pos so //
analyzed: gsil dkrol ba dang gzhan yang dge ba'i bkur sti chen pos so //
translated: The one who plays the cymbals and others also do so with great respect.

original: khung bu rtseg mas yul bskor ba'i tshe dang gling dang sil dkrol ba sna tshang bar dkrol zhing mchod /
analyzed: khung bu rtseg mas yul bskor ba'i tshe dang gling dang sil dkrol ba sna tshang bar dkrol zhing mchod /
translated: When turning the country with the layered holes, the cymbals and other instruments are played completely and offerings are made.

original: kha na ma tho ba med pa ni dkrol ba'i phyir kyee skyes bu ston pa la mchod pa gyis shig ces brjod pa'o //
analyzed: kha na ma tho ba med pa ni dkrol ba'i phyir kyee skyes bu ston pa la mchod pa gyis shig ces brjod pa'o //
translated: The one without fault is the one who plays the cymbals, saying, Hey man, make offerings to the teacher.

original: khang bu rtseg ma dang yul bskor ba'i tshe dud pa la sogs pa la rda rdung zhing mchod cig ces bsgo'ang 'di'i tshe ni nyes par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: khang bu rtseg ma dang yul bskor ba'i tshe dud pa la sogs pa la rda rdung zhing mchod cig ces bsgo'ang 'di'i tshe ni nyes par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If one is in a multi-storied building or on a journey, one should make offerings to the smoke, etc. and so forth.

original: grong dang tshong dus dang bzhi'i @343b dang mngon sum dag tu sang ngam gnangs sangs rgyas gshegs pa 'byung ngo zhes 'gro ba la bris pa la ba lang gi steng du bzhon te rgyal mtshan dang gdugs kyis bskor ba bslabs so //
analyzed: grong dang tshong dus dang bzhi'i @343b dang mngon sum dag tu sang ngam gnangs sangs rgyas gshegs pa 'byung ngo zhes 'gro ba la bris pa la ba lang gi steng du bzhon te rgyal mtshan dang gdugs kyis bskor ba bslabs so //
translated: In the villages, markets, and four directions, one should write, ‚ÄúTomorrow or the day after, the Buddha will come,‚Äù and go. One should be trained in riding on the back of an ox, surrounded by banners and parasols.

original: yul bskor ba'i zhag gnyis gsum gyi mdun du grong mi thams cad la grong bar phyag dar dang chag chag dang mchod pa gyis shig ces dge slong ngam khyim pas ba lang la bzhon pa thams cad du rgyas bar bsgo /
analyzed: yul bskor ba'i zhag gnyis gsum gyi mdun du grong mi thams cad la grong bar phyag dar dang chag chag dang mchod pa gyis shig ces dge slong ngam khyim pas ba lang la bzhon pa thams cad du rgyas bar bsgo /
translated: In front of the two or three day journey of the tour of the country, the monk or the householder should proclaim everywhere to all the villagers, ‚ÄúSweep the village, sprinkle it with water, and make offerings.‚Äù

original: byang chub sems dpa'i gzugs bya ba chos so //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i gzugs bya ba chos so //
translated: It is the Dharma to make an image of the Bodhisattva.

original: byang chub sems dpa' gzugs rin po che sna bdun la sogs pa las byas kyang nyes med /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' gzugs rin po che sna bdun la sogs pa las byas kyang nyes med /
translated: Even if the Bodhisattva is made of the seven precious substances, etc., there is no fault.

original: 'di la rgyal mtshan gyi 'khor dang shing thags kyis bskor ba dang lcags kyi ka ba yang ngo //
analyzed: 'di la rgyal mtshan gyi 'khor dang shing thags kyis bskor ba dang lcags kyi ka ba yang ngo //
translated: It is surrounded by a fence and a hedge, and there are iron pillars.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i gzugs la ming gis smos pa 'di rnams bya /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i gzugs la ming gis smos pa 'di rnams bya /
translated: The forms of the bodhisattvas should be named as follows.

original: de la ba dan bcing /
analyzed: de la ba dan bcing /
translated: Hang banners on them.

original: ltag ma lta bu'i lcags kyi ka ba kho ra yug tu bskor ba la ba dan gdags /
analyzed: ltag ma lta bu'i lcags kyi ka ba kho ra yug tu bskor ba la ba dan gdags /
translated: Surround the iron pillars that are like the back of a saddle with a fence, and hang banners on them.

original: 'khor bya / byang chub kyi gzugs kyis yul bskor ba yang ltag ma sangs rgyas kyi gzugs bskor ba ltar bya /
analyzed: 'khor bya / byang chub kyi gzugs kyis yul bskor ba yang ltag ma sangs rgyas kyi gzugs bskor ba ltar bya /
translated: Encircle the forms of the bodhisattvas in the same way that you encircled the forms of the buddhas in the back.

original: lhab lhub kyis brgyan te ma gtogs pa ni zhabs kyi rgyan dang snyan cha'o //
analyzed: lhab lhub kyis brgyan te ma gtogs pa ni zhabs kyi rgyan dang snyan cha'o //
translated: Except for the ornaments of the feet, which are anklets and earrings,

original: byang chub kyi gzugs la za 'og la sogs pa'i na bza' dang rgyan sna tshogs kyis brgyan te bskor /
analyzed: byang chub kyi gzugs la za 'og la sogs pa'i na bza' dang rgyan sna tshogs kyis brgyan te bskor /
translated: encircle the forms of the bodhisattvas with various ornaments and garments such as brocade.

original: zhabs la gdu bu gdags pa dang snyan cha dang gnyis kyis ni mi brgyan /
analyzed: zhabs la gdu bu gdags pa dang snyan cha dang gnyis kyis ni mi brgyan /
translated: Do not ornament the feet with anklets and earrings.

original: spos kyi yan lag sbyin pa sbyin /
analyzed: spos kyi yan lag sbyin pa sbyin /
translated: Offer the gift of the limbs of incense.

original: byang chub kyi gzugs la tsan dan dang gur kum dang spos zhim pos bsku /
analyzed: byang chub kyi gzugs la tsan dan dang gur kum dang spos zhim pos bsku /
translated: Anoint the forms of the bodhisattvas with sandalwood, saffron, and fragrant incense.

original: khyogs dang shing rtas drang /
analyzed: khyogs dang shing rtas drang /
translated: The chariot is drawn by a palanquin.

original: byang chub kyi gzugs khyogs sam shing rta gang gis drangs kyang rung /
analyzed: byang chub kyi gzugs khyogs sam shing rta gang gis drangs kyang rung /
translated: It does not matter whether the form of enlightenment is drawn by a palanquin or a chariot.

original: gdugs dang rgyal mtshan dang ba dan der bsgreng /
analyzed: gdugs dang rgyal mtshan dang ba dan der bsgreng /
translated: An umbrella, victory banner, and flag are raised there.

original: byang chub kyi yul bskor ba'i tshe bus pa gzhon nu'i lag na ming gis smos pa 'di bskur la bskor /
analyzed: byang chub kyi yul bskor ba'i tshe bus pa gzhon nu'i lag na ming gis smos pa 'di bskur la bskor /
translated: When circumambulating the site of enlightenment, the child should be circumambulated while holding the name card.

original: me tog gis gong bu la gsol /
analyzed: me tog gis gong bu la gsol /
translated: Offer a ball of flowers.

original: dbu la me tog gi phreng bas brgyan /
analyzed: dbu la me tog gi phreng bas brgyan /
translated: Adorn the head with a garland of flowers.

original: yon lhung ba yang ngo //
analyzed: yon lhung ba yang ngo //
translated: Also, offer a begging bowl.

original: me tog dang pog spos lta bu gzugs kyi steng du gtor kyang nyes med /
analyzed: me tog dang pog spos lta bu gzugs kyi steng du gtor kyang nyes med /
translated: It is not a fault to scatter flowers and incense on the form.

original: gnas brtan gyis bsrung /
analyzed: gnas brtan gyis bsrung /
translated: The elder should protect it.

original: shing rta la phreng pa'i sgrom bya /
analyzed: shing rta la phreng pa'i sgrom bya /
translated: Make a garland box for the chariot.

original: shing rta'i mdun du bre 'dra bar gru bzhir byas la de'i nang du me tog sna tshogs gzhag la gtor /
analyzed: shing rta'i mdun du bre 'dra bar gru bzhir byas la de'i nang du me tog sna tshogs gzhag la gtor /
translated: In front of the chariot, make a square like a trough and place various flowers inside and scatter them.üîΩAlso, place a perfume box.

original: bsung gi sgom yang gzhag / shing rta'i mdun gyi steng du bag phye zhim po'i bsung gis bkang la gzhag / phreng ba gsol /
analyzed: bsung gi sgom yang gzhag / shing rta'i mdun gyi steng du bag phye zhim po'i bsung gis bkang la gzhag / phreng ba gsol /
translated: On top of the front of the chariot, place a box filled with the scent of delicious flour.üîΩWear a garland.

original: khyim pas phreng ba 'bul @344a * //
analyzed: khyim pas phreng ba 'bul @344a * //
translated: If a layperson offers a rosary,

original: na sku gzugs la gdags 'di'i mchod pa bzhin te sil dkrol zhi la 'gro ba 'dong nas brgyan gsil yul bskor pa zin nas rnga la sogs pa dang rgyan thams cad gcod /
analyzed: na sku gzugs la gdags 'di'i mchod pa bzhin te sil dkrol zhi la 'gro ba 'dong nas brgyan gsil yul bskor pa zin nas rnga la sogs pa dang rgyan thams cad gcod /
translated: it should be placed on a statue. Like this offering, when a bell is rung for peace, it should be rung from the top down. When a tour of the country is completed, all ornaments such as drums should be removed.

original: nub mo'o // ltag ma ltar rgyan dpog pa ni nub mo dbog / rab tu byung ba'i gnas su mchod pa bcas pa chos so //
analyzed: nub mo'o // ltag ma ltar rgyan dpog pa ni nub mo dbog / rab tu byung ba'i gnas su mchod pa bcas pa chos so //
translated: In the evening, the ornaments should be put away. It is Dharma to make offerings in the dwelling place of the ordained.

original: gtsug lag khang du khyim pa dge slong zhig gis zhing ngam grong zhig phul te dus dus su rtag par yul bskor ba gyis shig ces gzhag pa de bzhin mi chad par yul bskor ba'i rgyu dang yon zan du bya'o //
analyzed: gtsug lag khang du khyim pa dge slong zhig gis zhing ngam grong zhig phul te dus dus su rtag par yul bskor ba gyis shig ces gzhag pa de bzhin mi chad par yul bskor ba'i rgyu dang yon zan du bya'o //
translated: If a layperson offers a field or village to a monastery, saying Please make a regular tour of the country from time to time, that should be taken as a reason for an uninterrupted tour of the country, and the offerings should be accepted as alms.

original: ma brtags pa dang rten cing brtags pa spong na ma brtags pa'i bcu bsdus pa'o //
analyzed: ma brtags pa dang rten cing brtags pa spong na ma brtags pa'i bcu bsdus pa'o //
translated: If one abandons the unanalyzed and the dependent, the unanalyzed is included in the ten.

original: byi na ya'i mgo nas 'di'i bar du thams cad kyang zhal nas gsungs pa ste rung ngam mi rung ba dang gnang mi gnang par bshad pa'o //
analyzed: byi na ya'i mgo nas 'di'i bar du thams cad kyang zhal nas gsungs pa ste rung ngam mi rung ba dang gnang mi gnang par bshad pa'o //
translated: From the head of the Vinaya up to this point, everything is explained as spoken by the Buddha, whether it is suitable or not, whether it is permitted or not.

original: ltag tu bshad pa dang / 'og nas 'byung ba rigs pa ni bya /
analyzed: ltag tu bshad pa dang / 'og nas 'byung ba rigs pa ni bya /
translated: What is explained later and what is reasonable should be done.

original: mi rigs pa ni thams cad btang ste /
analyzed: mi rigs pa ni thams cad btang ste /
translated: What is unreasonable should all be abandoned.

original: 'dir ma bris mod kyang nyal te gcin mi gci ba la sogs pa ma brtags pa yin pas mi bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir ma bris mod kyang nyal te gcin mi gci ba la sogs pa ma brtags pa yin pas mi bya'o //
translated: Although it is not written here, since sleeping and not urinating, etc. are not examined, they should not be done.

original: ma brtags pa spyad pas 'bras bu dge bar 'gyur na bya'o //üîΩdge slong zhig tshe rabs stong gi bar du mtho ris na 'dug 'dug pa las byig gshur zhugs pa las khang pa bzang po la sogs pa spyar nas de'i nang du bsam gtan byas nas de'i dgra bcom par gyur pa lta bu ste mi dge ba spyad pa
analyzed: ma brtags pa spyad pas 'bras bu dge bar 'gyur na bya'o // dge slong zhig tshe rabs stong gi bar du mtho ris na 'dug 'dug pa las byig gshur zhugs pa las khang pa bzang po la sogs pa spyar nas de'i nang du bsam gtan byas nas de'i dgra bcom par gyur pa lta bu ste mi dge ba spyad pa
translated: If the result becomes virtuous by practicing what is not examined, it should be done.

original: las dge bar 'gyur na bya'o //
analyzed: las dge bar 'gyur na bya'o //
translated: A bhik·π£u who had been in the higher realms for a thousand lifetimes, having entered a pigsty, took a good house, etc. and meditated inside it, and became an arhat. If the result becomes virtuous by practicing non-virtue, it should be done.

original: phyi ma dang snyen cing snga ma spong na brtags pa'o //
analyzed: phyi ma dang snyen cing snga ma spong na brtags pa'o //
translated: If one abandons the former by serving the latter, it is examined.

original: sangs rgyas kyis gsungs pa nyes byas tsam gyi tshod kyang mi gnang zhes 'byung /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyis gsungs pa nyes byas tsam gyi tshod kyang mi gnang zhes 'byung /
translated: It is said that the Buddha does not permit even the slightest fault.

original: yul gyi rnam pa sbyar te /
analyzed: yul gyi rnam pa sbyar te /
translated: The text continues with the objects of the rule:

original: sems can gyi mig 'gag par 'gyur na nyes byas tsam btang la sems can gyi yid bzhin du bde bar byas kyang nyes pa med do //
analyzed: sems can gyi mig 'gag par 'gyur na nyes byas tsam btang la sems can gyi yid bzhin du bde bar byas kyang nyes pa med do //
translated: If the eyes of sentient beings were to cease, it would be a minor fault to give them away, but there would be no fault in making sentient beings happy according to their wishes.

original: mal stan gyi dngos po ste /
analyzed: mal stan gyi dngos po ste /
translated: The objects are beds and seats.

original: phran tshegs su gtogs pa'o //
analyzed: phran tshegs su gtogs pa'o //
translated: This is included in the minor downfalls.

original: rdzogs so / //
analyzed: rdzogs so / //
translated: It is complete.

original: /'dul ba'i mdo'i rtsa ba'i 'grel pa chung ba slob dpon mang du thos shing yon tan dang ldan pa yon tan gyi 'od thams cad yod par smra ba pas byas pa'o /
analyzed: /'dul ba'i mdo'i rtsa ba'i 'grel pa chung ba slob dpon mang du thos shing yon tan dang ldan pa yon tan gyi 'od thams cad yod par smra ba pas byas pa'o /
translated: This is the commentary on the root text of the Vinaya Sutra, written by the learned and virtuous master Gunaprabha, a proponent of the Sarvastivada school.
